Articles.Content:
The hypeplane/hypetrain stuff is growing more and more popular, and Bartling Industries sees the practicality of making what the consumers want!

(Konsumers)

And as they say on that ALIEN planet called Urth they say The Customer is always right!

Team-

Kenbobo5588 Leader/CEO/Everything related to Bartling Industries
So, this means you want to create parts on others requests right?

Like if somebody comes up with an idea and several others approve it?

Edited September 17, 2014 by Reddragon
Please don't. It just adds more attention to something that's stupid, and that only happens for a month. Don't make this yearly

Please don't. It just adds more attention to something that's stupid, and that only happens for a month. Don't make this yearly

Mr. Grumps is at it again.

It's a game for FUN! You don't have to ruin other's fun!
What do you think the ion engines use?

What do you think the ion engines use?

I dunno. Maybe real world Xenon and Kerbal Xenon is pure hype?

Please don't. It just adds more attention to something that's stupid, and that only happens for a month. Don't make this yearly

if you have nothing good to say about it just don't say it at all, its just rude.
Engines that run better with higher reputation? Wait...I think I'm taking this to seriously.

Engines that run better with higher reputation? Wait...I think I'm taking this to seriously.

that actually sounds great. Maybe a part that adds more hype the faster you go.
Seriously. Besides the weird meme repetition that some people "enjoy" what is the actual purpose of this?

suggestion! perhaps we could find a way to check the frequency of tweets involving KSP (I dont use twitter, so dont ask me.) and every time a tweet is made, you get some more fuel/ engines become more powerful/BOTH!!!/ETC.

suggestion! perhaps we could find a way to check the frequency of tweets involving KSP (I dont use twitter, so dont ask me.) and every time a tweet is made, you get some more fuel/ engines become more powerful/BOTH!!!/ETC.

One. Calm down.

Two. You will need module manager

Three. You currently CANNOT measure the amount of tweets in ksp.

Four. Joshwoo69 is currently NOT amused.

Seriously. Besides the weird meme repetition that some people "enjoy" what is the actual purpose of this?

Thanks! I Fully agree with you.

I know that some mods have connection to the outside world ie. internet.

Could it be done together with a plugin that looks for a specific forum thread and based on the number of replies , adds "hype" or thrust to the engine?

edit: should have read the tweet idea first.

One. Have fun your way, don't try to make other people have fun that same way (aka, if a thread isn't something you think is fun, cool, don't participate in the thread)

Two. You will need a plugin, ModuleManager likely won't help.

Three. Totally doable with C# (what plugins are written in). Probably wouldn't even be hard.

Four. Magico13 is amused, even though I likely won't use anything produced from this thread. Silliness is why I like KSP. Reminds me vaguely of the mods that iChun makes for Minecraft. Stupid but really, really well done.
